title: Ducks crack top 5 of AP poll; Canes top ACC pack
content: Oregon returned to the top five of The Associated Press Top 25 college football poll, while five ACC teams were ranked for the second time this season.

title: T.J. passes bro J.J. for most sacks in Watt family
content: With a strip sack of Bears quarterback Caleb Williams in the end zone, the Steelers' T.J. Watt, 31, surpassed J.J. Watt, 36, in career sacks.

title: FSU to retain embattled Norvell for 2026 season
content: Florida State football coach Mike Norvell, who is 7-16 (3-13 in ACC play) over the past two seasons, will return for a seventh year with the Seminoles.

title: Sources: Durant to miss 2 games for family issue
content: Rockets star Kevin Durant will miss the next two games -- at Phoenix and at Golden State -- while tending to a family matter, sources told ESPN.

title: Stars' Rantanen gets automatic one-game ban
content: Stars forward Mikko Rantanen received an automatic one-game suspension after getting ejected from his second game in a three-game span.

title: Nuggets' Gordon (hamstring) to miss 4-6 weeks
content: Nuggets starting forward Aaron Gordon has a Grade 2 strain of his right hamstring, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania. Gordon will be re-evaluated in four to six weeks.

title: Lanning swipes at SEC, touts Ducks' case for CFP
content: Dan Lanning allowed himself to do some CFP politicking after Oregon registered its 10th win of the season, a 42-27 victory over USC.

title: Sizing up the postseason picture, including every bowl matchup, with one week to go
content: While some teams look like CFP locks, there's still a lot to be determined as the regular season winds down.

title: Week 12 inactives: Status for Chris Godwin Jr., Alvin Kamara and others
content: Updated inactives and analysis based on the latest reports and official announcements leading up to kickoff.

title: Final prep for NFL Week 12: We have sleepers, QB questions, trends to watch and more
content: Will the Browns lean on the run in Shedeur Sanders' first start? Will Eagles-Cowboys come down to Jalen Hurts? Is Michael Wilson startable in fantasy?

title: How McLaren's microscopic Vegas DQ brought Verstappen into the title fight
content: A technical infraction as small as a hair's width saw both McLarens disqualified from Vegas, which has enormous ramifications for F1's title fight.

title: Bring on Rivalry Week! Status quo Saturday means chaos looms
content: Saturday didn't upset the status quo but instead set the scene for a potential dramatic final week of the regular season.

title: Eze haunts Spurs as Arsenal make statement of title intent
content: After nearly joining Spurs in the summer, Eberechi Eze savored his first North London derby with Arsenal by netting a hat trick against their rivals.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes: Which team should take Kenyon Sadiq in April?
content: We have NFL draft notes through CFB Week 13, including why Kenyon Sadiq is TE1 and whether Utah could have two early-pick OTs.

title: Browns' Shedeur Sanders to start at QB1: Answering key questions about the move
content: What we know as the fifth-round draft pick will become the 42nd QB to start for Cleveland Browns since 1999.

title: Gotham rides series of magic moments to win NWSL Championship
content: Nobody could be fooled into thinking that Gotham was the best team over the course of the NWSL season. But, on Saturday, the team's stars shone brightest when it counted most.

title: Can Cincy trio best Miami's Fab Four?
content: Lionel Messi and Co. face a tough road trip in the conference semis. Also on Sunday, Philly hosts NYCFC.

title: Did Haney silence critics? No denying stardom of Benavidez, 'Bam'
content: David Benavidez, Devin Haney, Jesse Rodriguez and Abdullah Mason all won on Saturday. Andreas Hale provides takeaways on all four fighters.

title: WNBA mock draft: There's a new No. 1 replacing Lauren Betts at the top
content: Four UCLA players, including Lauren Betts, are now projected first-round picks. But Spain's Awa Fam is No. 1.

title: NBA first-month lessons: What we're hearing on all 30 teams
content: Tim Bontemps takes the pulse of the league on OKC's chase for 70 wins, the potential post-Trae Hawks and more first-month standout storylines.

title: Videos show police search for Marshawn Kneeland before death
content: The Texas DPS released hours of video footage that details their search for Dallas Cowboys defensive end Marshawn Kneeland before he was found dead.

title: Pete Alonso's three most aggressive suitors so far -- and a few other fits for the free agent first baseman
content: For a second straight winter, the Mets' franchise home run king is seeking a long-term deal. Where might he land?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal lead Premier League trio in Yildiz chase
content: Arsenal want to sign Juventus star Kenan Yildiz before other Premier League clubs do. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: From Bihar to Bengal: How SIR is reshaping voter rolls; a deep dive into how it works
content: India's voter rolls are undergoing a Special Intensive Revision (SIR), a nationwide exercise to ensure accuracy. While the Election Commission calls it crucial for democracy, political parties allege it's a politically motivated move to alter electoral outcomes, sparking debate and legal challenges. The process aims for clean rolls but faces opposition concerns.

title: Will Kash Patel carry on? FBI's 'desi' Director in focus as Epstein files deadline looms
content: FBI Director Kash Patel, proud of his Hindu roots, is caught in a storm of controversy.  Allegations of meddling with Epstein's files and using FBI resources for his girlfriend are dogging him.  With lawsuits and internal FBI drama swirling, Patel's leadership is under a microscope, especially as the full Epstein documents are set to drop, possibly exposing powerful figures.

title: Nvidia chip smuggling case: US arrests tech firm CTO
content: Four individuals, including two American citizens and two PRC nationals residing in the U.S., have been charged with illegally exporting advanced Nvidia GPUs to China. The conspiracy involved falsifying paperwork and using a shell company to circumvent U.S. export controls, with over $3.89 million in wire transfers received from China to fund the scheme.

title: Explained: How new labour laws may cut take-home salary; raise PF & gratuity contributions
content: New labour codes effective November 21, 2025, mandate basic salary at 50% of CTC, potentially lowering take-home pay as retirement contributions rise. These unified laws aim to simplify compliance and boost worker safeguards. Expect higher provident fund and gratuity payments, impacting immediate earnings while enhancing long-term retirement security for employees.

title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman to employees in internal memo: Google’s AI success can create…
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman acknowledges Google's AI advancements, noting potential "temporary economic headwinds" but expressing confidence in OpenAI's rapid progress and leadership in the AI race. Despite concerns about slowing ChatGPT engagement, Altman urged employees to focus on achieving superintelligence, highlighting the company's strength and unique challenges.

title: Identifying the early signs of mouth cancer: Causes, diagnosis & more
content: Mouth cancer, a serious global health issue, often goes undetected until advanced stages. Key risk factors include tobacco, alcohol, and HPV. Early signs like persistent sores, unusual patches, or lumps demand immediate medical attention. Prompt diagnosis through examinations and biopsies, followed by treatments like surgery and radiation, significantly improves survival rates. Prevention through lifestyle changes and regular check-ups is paramount.

title: Jennifer Lopez performs hit tracks at Indian billionaire's Udaipur wedding
content: Global pop icon Jennifer Lopez electrified guests at an Indian billionaire's wedding in Udaipur with a high-energy performance.  She delivered a medley of her hit tracks, surprising attendees with bold, futuristic ensembles instead of Indian couture.  The star's electrifying act followed earlier performances by Bollywood celebrities.

title: $1 trillion squad: Musk, Zuckerberg, Pichai, and fellow billionaires break the internet
content: An AI-generated image of tech titans like Elon Musk and Mark Zuckerberg in a parking lot has gone viral, sparking memes and commentary. The "$1 trillion squad" photo perfectly captures the 2025 mood of AI races and billionaire influence, becoming a cultural phenomenon.

title: Mamdani says he will always call Trump a 'fascist' and 'despot'
content: Zohran Mamdani addressed the 'fascist' question again Sunday after President Donald Trump saved him from a difficult situation. The question was whether Mamdani still considered Trump as a 'despot' even after their first meeting that appeared very cordial. Trump said he did not mind being called a despot as he had been called much worse. Mamdani asserted that he still considered Trump as a 'fascist' and all the negative things he said about him in past.

title: Living in a parasocial world: When your new 'best friend' is a popular stranger
content: In 2025, 'parasocial' became the word of the year, reflecting a world where emotional bonds with public figures feel like friendships.  From influencers to athletes, this one-sided connection offers comfort and community, blurring lines between fantasy and reality.  This phenomenon, amplified by social media, shapes our modern human experience, bringing both joy and potential pitfalls.

title: 'Blood pressure is elevated': Hospital issues update on Mandhana’s father
content: Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana's wedding to singer Palash Muchhal, scheduled for November 23, has been indefinitely postponed. Her father, Shriniwas Mandhana, was hospitalised in Sangli with symptoms resembling a heart attack. He is currently under medical observation, with potential need for angiography, leading to the halt of all wedding festivities.

title: Stefon Diggs' lady love Cardi B raves about hospital stay after giving birth
content: Rapper Cardi B shared her positive hospital experience after giving birth. She praised the food and treatment, joking about getting pregnant again soon. Fans reacted to her comments online. Cardi B is preparing for her upcoming tour in February 2026. Her album 'Am I The Drama' was released on September 19.

title: Ciara on Russell Wilson: Maturity and 'fullness as a man' define their marriage
content: Singer Ciara revealed on the 'Angie Martinez IRL' podcast that her husband, Russell Wilson, despite being younger, acts as an emotional anchor due to his 'old soul' and maturity. She finds his grounded demeanor provides stability amidst NFL pressures and fame.  Ciara emphasized his 'fullness as a man' enriches their strong partnership.

title: Brittany Mahomes stuns in red leather on date with Patrick before Chiefs–Colts game
content: Patrick Mahomes and the Chiefs face a crucial home game against the Colts, needing a win to boost playoff hopes after two road losses. Off the field, Mahomes shared a personal moment with his wife, Brittany, enjoying a night out at their steakhouse, 1587 Prime, highlighting their connection amidst the NFL season's pressures.

title: 'Zero gratitude for our efforts': Trump slams Zelenskyy
content: US President Donald Trump has criticized Ukraine's leadership for a lack of gratitude for American support and accused European nations of continuing to buy Russian oil. He claimed the war wouldn't have occurred under his leadership and that a proposed peace plan, which reportedly includes Ukrainian concessions, is not his final offer.

title: Kidney health: Daily water intake, dehydration & overhydration risks explained
content: Kidneys balance the fluids and the salts in the bod, and keeps the urine clear. Clear urine means a lower chance of kidney stones and urinary infections. When you do not drink enough water, the kidneys have to work harder to make the urine more concentrated. That extra work can strain the kidneys over time

title: No entry ever: Indian man visits Canada to see newborn grandchild, harasses teens
content: An Indian national, Jagjit Singh, visiting Canada on a temporary visa, has been convicted of criminally harassing two teenage girls near their school. Singh's actions, including attempting to take photos and putting his arm around a student, led to his arrest and a jail sentence following which he has been ordered to be deported and never to return to Canada.

title: 'Sindh may return to India': Rajnath says 'borders can change'; cites civilisational link
content: Defence minister Rajnath Singh said borders can change and the Sindh region might rejoin India. highlighting country's long civilisational links with the region. Singh referenced L K Advani's views on Sindhi Hindus still not able to accept the separation. He added everyone who considers Indus river pious is our own.

title: Bigg Boss 19: Kunickaa Sadanand gets eliminated; Salman Khan praises her gameplay
content: Bigg Boss 19's latest Weekend Ka Vaar saw veteran actress Kunickaa Sadanand evicted. Salman Khan lauded her strong gameplay, stating the season would have been incomplete without her.  Contestants bid an emotional farewell, with Kunickaa sharing heartfelt advice.  Her departure leaves a void as the show heads towards its finale.

title: Class 10 student suicide: School counsellor dismissed his suicidal thoughts as a 'joke'
content: Classmates of 16-year-old Shourya Patil claim he told the school counselor about suicidal thoughts weeks before his death, but the concern was dismissed. Patil died by suicide on November 18, with his suicide note detailing sustained humiliation by four teachers who have since been suspended. Protesters are demanding justice.

title: 'Uncomfortable for me': US F-16 pilot 'shocked' that Dubai air show went on after Tejas crash
content: US F-16 pilot Captain Taylor Hiester expressed shock and discomfort as Dubai Air Show went on after a Tejas fighter jet crashed  killing Wing Commander Namansh Syal. Hiester's team, along with others, cancelled their performances out of respect, but he said when he returned to the site after an hour, he saw the crowd enjoying the show and the announcer hosting the show with unabated enthusiasm.

title: SC quota debate: Outgoing CJI Gavai defends collegium; pushes 'creamy layer' exclusion
content: Chief Justice BR Gavai defended the collegium system, stressing the importance of filtering out the 'creamy layer' from SC quotas and urging the government to take action. He expressed regret over not appointing enough women judges during his tenure and reaffirmed his decision to forgo post-retirement positions, ensuring his contentment with his judicial service.

title: Israel targets Hezbollah 'chief of staff' in Beirut strike; 5 dead, 28 injured
content: Israel launched an air strike in Beirut, targeting Hezbollah's chief of staff in a residential building. The attack resulted in five deaths and 28 injuries, according to Lebanon's health ministry. Prime Minister Netanyahu's office confirmed the operation, stating the target was a senior operative involved in Hezbollah's rearmament.

title: ‘They were a bit too defensive’: Steyn lambasts India after Day 2 poor show
content: Dale Steyn criticised India's bowling strategy on Day 2 of the second Test against South Africa, citing a lack of adaptation and overly defensive field placements. Senuran Muthusamy's maiden Test century and Marco Jansen's aggressive 93 were pivotal in South Africa reaching 489, a performance Anil Kumble lauded for its impact.

title: What is China's illegal ‘996’ work culture that Narayana Murthy has pitched for India
content: Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy's suggestion of a 72-hour workweek, referencing China's "996" culture, has reignited debate. While China's "996" model powered its tech boom, it led to burnout and was eventually declared illegal due to its detrimental impact on workers' well-being.

title: Isaac Johnson cause of death: How did the Chicago MMA fighter die at 31
content: Chicago's own Isaac Johnson, a 31-year-old fighter, tragically collapsed during a heavyweight Thai boxing match at the Matador Fighter Challenge. Despite quick medical attention and transport to Loyola University Medical Center, he was pronounced dead shortly after midnight. Authorities have launched an investigation, awaiting an autopsy to determine the cause of his untimely demise.  Tributes pour in for the warrior.

title: Why excessive sweating may signal low blood pressure: Causes and signs
content: Experiencing excessive sweating with low blood pressure can be unsettling. This combination may indicate dehydration, heat exhaustion, low blood sugar, infections, or heart problems. Recognizing these warning signs is crucial for quick action and safety. Immediate steps include sitting or lying down, rehydrating, and cooling down.

title: 'Ek series tera, ek tera': Axar's omission from ODIs sparks memes, questions & sarcasm
content: KL Rahul will captain India in the upcoming ODI series against South Africa, with Ravindra Jadeja returning to the squad. Axar Patel's omission has sparked fan outrage on social media, with many questioning the decision. "Axar Patel getting dropped from ODI setup is so shocking," one user said in a post on X.

title: Russia-Ukraine conflict: Kyiv drone strike sparks major fire at power station near Moscow
content: Ukraine launched a significant drone attack on Russia's Shatura Power Station in the Moscow region, causing a large fire and disrupting heating for thousands. This marks one of Kyiv's most substantial strikes on energy infrastructure deep within Russian territory, impacting a facility vital to the region's power supply.

title: COLA increases Social Security payments for 2026: Boosts confirmed for retirees
content: Social Security beneficiaries will see a 2.8% increase in their monthly payments starting January 2026. This adjustment will benefit over 75 million Americans, including retirees and disabled workers. While welcome, the rise may not fully cover escalating living costs, especially healthcare. Higher earnings limits for those working while receiving benefits are also set for 2026.

title: Nicholas Singh arrested: Indian-origin on Canada's 'most wanted' list nabbed after 18 mths
content: A fugitive of Indian origin, Nicholas Singh, has been apprehended in Toronto after an 18-month evasion. Previously on Canada's 'most wanted list,' Singh was serving a lengthy sentence for armed robbery and other offenses.  Authorities discovered him with a firearm, leading to new charges including illegal possession of a regulated weapon.

title: 'Father's condition kept worsening': Smriti Mandhana–Muchhal wedding postponed
content: Smriti Mandhana and Palash Muchhal's wedding, slated for this Sunday in Sangli, has been indefinitely postponed due to the cricketer's father's ill health. The family is requesting privacy during this difficult time. The couple, who made their relationship public in July 2024, had planned an intimate ceremony. Their focus is now on the father's recovery.

title: 'Country in chaos': Rahul slams SIR after BLOs death; calls revision 'imposed tyranny'
content: Rahul Gandhi has alleged widespread "chaos" due to the special intensive revision of electoral rolls, claiming 16 Booth Level Officers died from work-related stress. He called the exercise an "imposed tyranny" and a "conspiracy" to protect those in power.

title: IND vs SA: Why KL Rahul will lead India in ODI series against South Africa - Explained
content: KL Rahul will captain India in the upcoming three-match ODI series against South Africa due to injuries to regular captain Shubman Gill and vice-captain Shreyas Iyer. The squad sees the return of Ravindra Jadeja and the inclusion of Tilak Varma in the middle order, while Jasprit Bumrah has been rested.

title: Top cardiologist warns of one morning habit causing heart attacks minutes after waking
content: Cortisol, as we know is the stress hormone, that can raise blood pressure and heart during mental or emotional stress. The cortisol surge lowers heart rate variability. Dr. Heigl, showed data from continuous ECG monitors: in patients with cardiac events, heart rate variability dropped sharply within minutes of waking

title: India’s employability gap: What rising male gains and female fluctuations mean
content: The India Skills Report 2026 reveals a sharp shift in gendered employability trends, with men overtaking women in 2025 before women regained a narrow lead this year. The six-year swing highlights how technical-skill demand, systemic barriers, and divergent regional preferences shape workforce outcomes. The findings raise urgent questions about equity, access, and India’s preparedness for a gender-balanced labour market.

title: Salute & tears: Wing Commander Afshan's emotional goodbye to husband Namansh Syal
content: Wing Commander Namansh Syal died in a Tejas fighter jet crash in Dubai. The aircraft crashed during an aerobatic demonstration. His mortal remains were brought to his native village in Himachal Pradesh. Villagers and family members paid emotional tributes. The Indian Air Force is investigating the cause of the mishap. This is the second Tejas crash since its induction.

title: IND vs SA: Gill likely to reach CoE a week before T20I series; roadmap unclear so far
content: Shubman Gill, India's Test and ODI captain, is currently resting in Mumbai following a roadmap set by medical experts. He is expected to join the BCCI Centre of Excellence around December 1st or 2nd, a week before the T20I series against South Africa begins.  His availability for the T20Is is still uncertain as the team management explores all options.

title: McRae and Hughes quietly move from rumor-mill chatter to an online spectacle
content: A fan photo of Tate McRae and Jack Hughes in Manhattan sparked dating rumors, but Lexi Brown's humorous take on McRae's outfit, wearing Hughes' team colors, shifted the narrative. This playful interaction highlights McRae's embrace of hockey culture while Hughes recovers from a hand injury, offering fans an encouraging update on his well-being.

title: Will Jalen Hurts play vs Cowboys today? Latest injury update on Eagles quarterback
content: Philadelphia Eagles quarterback Jalen Hurts is set to play against the Dallas Cowboys today, with no injury concerns. He recently addressed speculation about teammate frustration, emphasizing his commitment to accountability and internal improvement. The highly anticipated game kicks off at 4:25 p.m. ET on FOX.

title: 'Nothing to say': Kharge on K'taka power tussle; Cong chief says high command will decide
content: Karnataka chief minister Siddaramaiah's tenure is under renewed speculation as the Congress government reaches its halfway mark. Party chief Mallikarjun Kharge stated the high command will decide on any leadership changes, while Siddaramaiah maintains the buzz is media-driven. Friction reportedly exists over a cabinet reshuffle, with supporters of Deputy CM D.K. Shivakumar seeking clarity on leadership first.

title: Bengaluru techie duped of Rs 48 lakh by fake Ayurvedic 'Guruji'; suffers kidney damage
content: A 29-year-old software engineer was allegedly defrauded of Rs 48 lakh by a self-proclaimed Ayurvedic healer and a medicine shop. The healer sold him costly herbal products, claiming they would cure his sexual health issues. The victim's health reportedly worsened after consuming the medicines, leading to kidney complications.

title: Manipur Proposed To Remove 'Any Kuki Tribes' From ST List. Tribal Affairs Ministry Says...
content: The inclusion or exclusion of communities in the Scheduled Tribes (ST) list in Manipur "may be kept on hold" due to the "sensitive nature of the prevailing situation" in the state, the Ministry of Tribal Affairs said in response to RTI queries.

title: Mamdani Views Trump As Fascist Despite Friendly White House Meeting
content: New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani didn't back down in an interview that aired Sunday from past criticism that President Donald Trump acted like a despot and a fascist after a surprisingly friendly White House meeting between the two men.

title: 50 Children Kidnapped From Nigerian Catholic School Escape Captivity
content: At least 50 of the more than 300 children snatched by gunmen from a Catholic school in Nigeria have escaped their captors, a Christian group said on Sunday, as the president announced the rescue of 38 worshippers seized in a separate attack last week

title: Explained: What's Behind Nigeria's Latest School Kidnappings, Church Attack
content: Nigeria has grabbed global headlines again following a spate of attacks by gunmen involving the kidnapping of dozens of students from two

title: Ex-Brazilian President Bolsonaro Says Tried To Break Ankle Monitor Due To 'Paranoia'
content: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro said on Sunday he had medicine-induced "paranoia" that led him to violate his electronic ankle monitor

title: Netanyahu Vows To Keep Striking Hamas And Hezbollah
content: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu insisted on Sunday that Israel would do "everything necessary" to stop Hezbollah from regrouping in Lebanon and Hamas from doing the same in Gaza.

title: Zelensky Thanks Trump After His Angry Post On Ungrateful Ukraine
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky sought to win back Donald Trump's favour on Sunday, after the US leader blasted at Kyiv amidst crucial talks in Geneva to end the war with Russia.

title: Who Was Haytham Tabatabai, Top Hezbollah Leader Killed By Israel In Beirut
content: The Israeli military conducted a strike in Beirut on Sunday in an attempt to assassinate senior Hezbollah leader Haytham Ali Tabatabai, Israeli officials said.

title: 'New Era Of Coercive Clarity In India's Security Doctrine': Report After Op Sindoor
content: India is undergoing a profound transformation in its national security posture, replacing decades of predictable restraint with a far more assertive doctrine rooted in pre-emption, coercive leverage, and strategic autonomy.

title: "Doesn't Exist": Trump's DOGE Shuts Down With 8 Months Left On Its Charter
content: US President Donald Trump's Department of Government Efficiency has disbanded with eight months left to its mandate, ending an initiative launched with fanfare as a symbol of Trump's pledge to slash the government's size

title: Woman Doctor Dies By Suicide In Hyderabad Over US Visa Rejection: Cops
content: A 38-year-old woman doctor from Guntur district in Andhra Pradesh has allegedly died by suicide at her flat in Hyderabad due to depression over not getting US visa, said a police official on Sunday.

title: IMF Report Exposes "Corrosive" Corruption At Pakistan's Highest Levels
content: In a scathing new assessment, the International Monetary Fund (IMF) has released a 186-page Governance and Corruption Diagnostic Report that lays bare Pakistan's deep-rooted governance failures.

title: PM Modi Holds Bilateral Talks With Japanese PM On Sidelines Of G20 Summit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday met with his Japanese counterpart Sanae Takaichi on the sidelines of the G20 Summit here and discussed bilateral cooperation in areas like innovation, defence and talent mobility.

title: India, Canada Look To Reset Ties As Talks Begin On Key Trade Deal CEPA
content: In a significant diplomatic breakthrough, India and Canada have agreed to launch negotiations on a high-ambition Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA), marking a major reset in ties after years of turbulence.

title: Public Holiday In Delhi On Tuesday To Mark Guru Tegh Bahadur's Shaheedi Purab
content: The Delhi Government has announced a public holiday on Tuesday to mark the 350th Shaheedi Purab of Guru Tegh Bahadur.

title: Ex CIA Spy Reveals How Nuclear Scientist Had Pak Generals 'On His Payroll'
content: James Lawler outlined how these covert efforts eventually drew in AQ Khan's proliferation network. The US had monitored Khan's role in building Pakistan's nuclear capability for years before analysts realised the scale of his outward trafficking.

title: France Honours British Indian Spy Noor Inayat Khan With New Postage Stamp
content: Noor Inayat Khan, a descendent of the 18th-century Mysore ruler Tipu Sultan, has become the only Indian-origin woman to be honoured with a commemorative postage stamp by France for her role in the French Resistance as an undercover British agent.

title: Protest Against Toxic Air In Delhi Turns Violent, Cops Hit With Pepper Spray
content: A group of protesters demonstrating at the India Gate over rising air pollution in Delhi-NCR allegedly attacked police personnel with pepper spray while being removed from the site on Sunday, an official said.

title: Deaths Of 320 Maoist Cadres In A Year Lay Bare Organisation's Losses
content: The Maoist's Central Committee has said that 320 of its cadres have been killed across the country in the last 11 months, exposing the scale of losses the organisation has suffered amid intensified security operations.

title: 5 Killed, 28 Injured In Israel's First Strike In Beirut In Months
content: Israel said it had carried out an air strike Sunday targeting Hezbollah's chief of staff in Beirut, leaving a smoking hole in the side of an apartment building and debris scattered in the street

title: Dak Prescott poised to become Cowboys' career passing leader
content: dak Prescott would become the Dallas Cowboys' career passing leader . his predecessor, Tony Romo, had 34,183 yards in his career . "thankful to be healthy and to be in this position to do it," Prescott says .

title: AP Week 13 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team
content: the only teams from last week's top 25 to lose were Georgia Tech, which struggled against unranked Pitt, and Illinois, which couldn't get anything going against Wisconsin . the only other ranked teams to lose was Missouri, which fell in a low-scoring affair against Oklahoma, and USC, which lost to no. 7 Oregon.

title: 🏈 Projecting the College Football Playoff top 12
content: the Sooners beat the Tigers 17-6 in Norman . there wasn't any movement in this week's top 12 projection . a dominant win against a now sub.-500 team isn't going to change the way the committee views Ohio State as the most complete team in the country .

title: Eagles' kelly green, Texans' battle red uniforms top NFL Week 12 threads
content: the Texans wore their all-battle-red threads on "Thursday Night Football" the combination debuted last season and features a bullhorn on the helmet and shoulder . the Eagles remain undefeated in it since it debuted in 2023 .

title: NFL Week 12's fashionable arrivals, featuring Browns QB Shedeur Sanders
content: week 12 of the season delivered another wave of pregame tunnel looks that matched the stakes on the field . from understated tunnel walks to full-on runway moments, Week 12 delivered a wave of tunnel looks . the last week of football action before Thanksgiving means that November football is in full swing .

title: Superlatives: NC State's bizarre punt recovery and a salute to a surgeon
content: the "SportsCenter" top 10 nominations aren't the only moments that make college football amazing . highlights reel plays are great, but highlights are great . some of the sport's greatest charms come off the beaten path .

title: A year after Ruben Amorim's Man Utd debut, things are finally turning
content: Ruben Amorim arrived at carrington for the first time last season . he agreed to leave Sporting CP halfway through . the majority of his squad were away playing for their countries . it was a cold international break when he arrived at the club .

title: Our guide to every Week 12 game: Matchup previews, predictions, picks and nuggets
content: Rich Eisen sees flashes of greatness from J.J. McCarthy and predicts a road win at Green Bay . the Chiefs hope to get their season back on track against the Colts . two of the league's most exciting offenses -- the Bucs and the Rams -- face off .

title: Updated SP+ rankings for all 136 FBS teams
content: SP+ is intended to be predictive and forward-facing . it does not automatically give credit for big wins or particularly brave scheduling . if you're strong and unimpressive in a loss, your rating will probably fall .

title: Italy sweeps Spain, reigns again as Davis champs
content: it's a fourth Davis Cup title for Italy and a third in a row . the last nation to win three straight titles was the united states . Italy won all three of its matches 2-0 this week after eliminating Austria in the quarterfinals .

title: Lakshmi Mittal quits UK as Labour’s wealth taxes trigger billionaire exodus
content: lakshmi Mittal is one of the richest men and a long-time labour donor . the 75-year-old steel magnate has left the UK just days before the autumn budget . he has become a tax resident of Switzerland and plans to spend most of his time in Dubai .

title: Borders may change anytime, Sindh may be back in India: Rajnath Singh
content: the defence minister says the country of Sindh will always be civilisationally a part of India . he says the region of Pakistan will always remain civilised . the country is a symbol of India's cultural identity and ethos .

title: India, Italy announce joint initiative for co-op in combating financing of terrorism as PM Modi meets Meloni
content: During the meeting on the sidelines of the G20 summit, the two leaders adopted the India-Italy Joint Initiative to Counter Financing of Terrorism, which reiterates their common resolve to fight terrorism

title: Kochi may see more fever casesas weather patterns change
content: A total of 9,848 fever cases were reported in the month up to November 18, 2025, according to Health department statistics

title: Rejection of nominations deals a blow to parties in Ernakulam
content: Cong. has taken the biggest hit with 4 of its official candidates losing chance to contest; DCC chief alleges that election officials colluded with ruling LDF to reject the party’s candidates’ nominations

title: U.S. tech majors oppose Indian telcos’ demand to allocate spectrum in 6 GHz band for mobile services
content: The tech majors sought the entire 6GHz band to be allocated for Wi-Fi services instead, as the technical and commercial readiness is not established for mobile services

title: Satish Jarkiholi and Parameshwara send a political message by saying Congress came to power due to team effort
content: In what is being seen as a bid to undermine Deputy Chief Minister and KPCC president D.K Shivakumar, two of his Cabinet colleagues, Satish Jarkiholi and G. Parameshwara on Sunday said that the Congress came to power owing to a team effort

title: Depression over the Bay likely on November 24, no heavy rainfall warnings for State
content: The IMD forecasts the system may intensify into a cyclone by November 26 but has not specified which coastal States could be affected. Andhra Pradesh currently has no heavy rainfall or fishermen warnings

title: PM Modi departs Johannesburg after concluding his engagements at G-20 Leaders’ Summit
content: Modi on Sunday met his Canadian counterpart Mark Carney, Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi, Italian premier Giorgia Meloni, South African President Cyril Ramaphosa and his counterparts from Jamaica and the Netherlands

title: Opposition demands ECI action against Deputy CM Ajit Pawar’s statement on funds for votes
content: Video of Deputy Chief Minister linking development funds to votes triggers demand for Election Commission intervention

title: Geo TV’s claims on Rafale losses ‘entirely fabricated’: French Navy
content: The French Navy asserted that it had not made any comments on possible Chinese jamming of Indian Rafale jets

title: Bangladesh seeks Sheikh Hasina’s extradition, says Foreign Affairs Adviser
content: Letter sent to India after International Crimes Tribunal verdict; Dhaka awaits response from Ministry of External Affairs

title: Allay fears of people over SIR, West Bengal Governor tells ECI and State government
content: Ananda Bose’s call comes amid the BJP’s allegation of ‘change of demography’ in border districts due to infiltration from Bangladesh and the Trinamool Congress’s charge that 100-150 voters are being deleted from every booth ‘at the behest of one political party’

title: Presidential Reference opinion does not overrule a judgmen, says Justice Gavai
content: Justice Gavai says the Presidential Reference can clarify the law and say a judgment is wrong; he says the court has “only relaxed the timeline... (and) balanced it by saying the Governor cannot sit on a Bill endlessly”

title: Kharge says high command will take decision on leadership
content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah had met the AICC president on November 22 and it was speculated that D.K. Shivakumar would also meet him, but the meeting didn’t happen

title: Mind your ‘administrative’ language, says Supreme Court report
content: It wants job titles such as Halalkhor, Cycle Sawar, Dhobi, Coolie, Scavenger, Masalchi, Malan, Basta Bardhar, Chowkidar, Bundle lifter be abandoned

title: Sindh may ‘return to India someday’, says Rajnath Singh
content: Singh recalled the Supreme Court’s 2005 ruling upholding the inclusion of the word Sindh in the national anthem

title: TPCC chief Mahesh Goud donates 11 acres for school, power substation in his native village
content: He participated in the bhoomi puja for a new Durga Devi temple, being constructed by the Endowments Department at a cost of ₹50 lakh

title: Three injured after van overturns in Vellore
content: Based on an alert, Vellore North police rescued injured persons, who were admitted at Government Medical College Hospital in Vellore.

title: Kerala to approach courts if Bills are kept pending with Governor, President beyond ‘reasonable time’
content: In response to a Presidential Reference, the Supreme Court had indicated that only a limited judicial review was possible on Bills pending beyond reasonable time. The State government may have to be clear on when to initiate legal action as the SC did not elaborate on the ‘reasonable time’

title: Bird strike at Dehradun airport: IndiGo plane damaged; all passengers safe
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." Read More

title: Amid 'SIR deaths', officials say Phase-2 easier than Bihar exercise
content: Image used for representative purposes Bharti Jain is senior editor with The Times of India, New Delhi. She has been writing on security matters since 1996. Having covered the Union home ministry, security agencies, Election Commission and the ‘prime’ political beat, the Congress, for The Economic Times all these years, she moved to TOI in August 2012. Her repertoire of news stories delves into the whole gamut of issues related to terrorism and internal strife, besides probing strategic affairs in India’s neighbourhood. Read More

title: 2nd 'key witness' identifies Yasin Malik as 'main shooter' in 1990 IAF killings
content: a second "key eyewitness" has identified in court jailed Kashmiri separatist Yasin Malik as the "main shooter" in the 1990 terrorist attack in which four unarmed IAF personnel were killed and 22 others wounded . the unnamed witness's testimony comes 22 months after a retired colleague of the victims first identified him as the main armed assailant .

title: BJP objects to Muslim intake in Vaishno Devi Medical College, stirs row
content: BJP, VHP and Bajrang Dal have objected to admissions of students from Kashmir to mata Vaishno Devi Medical College in Katra . the college filled seats strictly on NEET’s merit list and reserved 85% of its seats for J&K domiciles . only eight Hindu students from Jammu made it to the first batch of 50 .

title: CPI(M) local secretary accused of threatening candidate
content: A former area secretary of the party, contesting as Independent, says he was threatened by the party’s local secretary

title: Vizhinjam to play role in Kerala’s green hydrogen initiative
content: Plans afoot for regional green hydrogen ecosystem, with Kochi and Thiruvananthapuram as hubs, under the Hydrogen Valley Innovation Cluster (HVIC) initiative

title: Political fronts keen to boost panchayat tally in Ernakulam to win perception battle
content: Fronts in Ernakulam are counting on every institution to secure a win and shape a broader political narrative ahead of the upcoming Assembly elections

title: J&K L-G chairs security review meeting in Jammu amid crackdown
content: Kashmir has witnessed a spurt in local doctors allegedly joining terror ranks this year, a trend that security analysts consider worrying

title: ‘Vilayath Buddha’ movie review: mass masala aspirations brings down a film with a compelling core
content: Writer G.R. Indugopan, along with co-screenwriter Rajesh Pinnadan, banks more on the massy side of the things, much of which are familiar recreations from umpteen films of the genre

title: Tejas aircraft crash in Dubai sparks speculation over its export prospects
content: Aviation experts, however, cautioned against premature conclusions until the joint investigation report is released

title: BRS slams number mismatch in BC, SC, ST quota for GP polls
content: Question logic of using 2024 caste census figures for BC reservations in gram panchayat elections while relying on 2011 census data for SC and ST reservations

title: Cyberabad police warn of rising cyber threats targeting youth and families
content: Caution public that online betting, deepfake videos, romance scams, manipulative social-media content, and harmful games are emerging as silent threats, often infiltrating households through mobile phones

title: PAV urges State to drop PPP plan for new medical colleges
content: Health activists question the need for private participation when land, funds and regulatory systems are already in place, and ask the government to operationalise all proposed colleges through full public funding and administration

title: Change of guard imminent as no-confidence move gathers pace in Nellore civic body
content: Minister P. Narayana and MLA Sridhar Reddy firm up plan to unseat Mayor Potluri Sravanthi; NDA bloc secures majority signatures and will submit its plea to the Collector on Monday

title: Consensus on most recommendations of Assam Accord Clause 6: State govt.
content: The clause deals with the implementation of constitutional, legislative, and administrative safeguards for the indigenous people

title: SIT inches closer to fixing legal liability for chartering Sabarimala artefacts for private worship
content: Video footage show main suspect Unnikrishnan Potti offering puja to gold-plated panels covering the doorway of the sanctum sanctorum and the moulds of Dwarapalakas on the premises of wealthy patrons

title: BJP asks J&K Lt. Governor to bar admission of Muslim students at Mata Vaishno Devi varsity, evokes sharp reaction
content: A BJP delegation submitted a memorandum to L-G Manoj Sinha after the MBBS admission list for 50 seats featured 42 Muslims

title: Three, including a couple,  electrocuted as power cable falls on them in Cuddalore district
content: Owing to heavy rain and strong winds, a tamarind tree uprooted and fell on an overhead power cable, which snapped and fell on the three sitting in front of their house at Sathamangalam. They died on the spot
